item.title: Autumn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Autumn add a quote by D. J. MacHale
item.description: "There are two types of people in this world. People who hate clowns...and clowns. (Bobby Pendragon)" -- D. J. MacHale

item.title: Autumn add a quote by George Sand
item.description: "We cannot tear out a single page of our life, but we can throw the whole book in the fire." -- George Sand

item.title: Autumn add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description:
"All my life, my heart has sought a thing I cannot name.
Remembered line from a long- forgotten poem" -- Hunter S. Thompson
